The sand nourishes the dead until their time of arising. Our troops will be strengthened by the earth.
Like the desert wind, our riders will move fiercely and swiftly with the Faceless God at their shoulders.
To lose one of our most prestigious, most sacred temples is a risk too great to bear. We cannot risk its collapse - use everything to reinforce it and prevent that from occurring.
Pah! The cities of the Tomb Kings have stood for millennia and will continue to - so great is the power of their creators. Do nothing and no catastrophe shall befall us.
In time, this whole world will turn to sand; first this river, then the oceans! At the end, our empire will continue to stand, unswerving and eternal.
Tasking our slaves with changing the river's course could be the key to averting disaster, along with all the prayers and rites to the higher powers that we can muster!
Our many bound servants have been busied labouring for our greatness, but we can spare a small number to labour at our venerable Liche Priests' behest.

Without the tireless work of the Liche Priests, the Tomb Kings would not be properly preserved and adequately prepared for their glorious reawakenings. We must give the Mortuary Cult that which they ask, lest their great work be halted!
Our focus should be on restoring those buildings which provide troops for our armies. Doing so will hasten the reconquest of our former territories.
The greatest empires were launched from stable foundations. Improving the buildings that form our essential infrastructure will surely bring us closer to paradise?
One thousand years confined to his tomb, with maybe just a few scarabs and scorpions for company, should teach this treacherous cleric the error of his ways!
Let him talk, allow him his intrigue and scheming, for in the end everyone serves their Unliving liege, one way or another.
There is secret knowledge to be found inside that chamber. We should continue our excavation to uncover it at once.
There are many other tombs to be explored here, whose rewards are just as fruitful and could be unearthed much more quickly.
These 'men' are not warriors - they are not even real men - and are therefore not worthy of our time and attention. Move on!
All must serve the Tomb Kings one way or another Spare no expense: use the Lizardmen's flesh and blood to ensure those Tomb Kings yet to awaken do so stronger than ever before!
Possibly, our labourers have not worked hard enough. A swelling of their numbers, and some encouragement with the lash, should better align their priorities with our own!
Reinforcing the contingent guarding the sinking tomb would show prudence - our troops will ensure that the pyramid remains above ground.
It matters not what power controls the Necrosphinx, only that it obeys our orders and brings destruction to our enemies on command!
Usekph, you say? We cannot allow those gods shunned by our ancestors a new foothold on our sands - order the Necrosphinx back underground to be with its dusty patron!
We have slaves aplenty, and no need of living mouths which must be fed lest they cease to breathe. Let them wander but offer no help; they will most likely perish in the unforgiving sands.
Any found wandering our lands are the property of the Tomb Kings! Really, it is a simple matter: they are in our lands so they belong to us. Put them to work digging, and don't spare the lash!
Long ago, Alcadizaar fought to defeat a great evil from our lands. We should honour the loyalty of his troops by observing the correct funeral rites.
We can be certain that the Conqueror no longer requires his servants, at least not on this mortal plane. Let us use their desiccated bones in continuance of our quest for a worldly-paradise!

Bah! Every pirate worth their salt has brought down a dozen curses upon themselves, so whats one more?
This prize isnt worth the trouble it 'arbours. The bottom of the ocean shall 'ave a new trinket! Let's throw it overboard an' forget this affair ever 'appened.
Masters of the ballistic arts, even in death Gunnery Wights maintain the lines and a steady flow of black powder.
Fearsome creatures of the night; the very stuff of nightmares. Mourngul Haunters strike fear into the hearts of their helpless prey.
Our oldest foe 'as long been a thorn in our side, so we should take delight in this opportunity to gain both riches an' deliver a slight to our enemies.

The consequences of destroying this temple far outweigh the value of this idol. Takin' it would therefore make us 'enemy number one' of every coldblood in Lustria! Best we leave it alone, I reckon for now at least.
We should make 'aste for this site - these veterans sailors must be made part of our crew. We can't risk losin' 'em to the ocean, or worse yet - to other pirates with a talent for raisin' the dead!
The ocean's filled with the rottin' corpses of the dead, but why rush to a watery grave? Instead, 'ow about we take advantage of the lull in naval action against us?
We must be cautious when moving ahead - reef the sails an' keep alert. I daresay Manann would not intervene so flippantly
We mustn't be so suspicious of each an' every change in the tides. If Manann truly is warning us, we'll just 'ave to deal wiv the danger as it arises.

Those sanctimonious sops in armour, the Bretonnians, 'ave sent an 'eavily-defended convoy of merchant ships our way. Crow reckons they be heading to Araby, and by their sluggishness I'd say they're carrying a goodly haul by those escorts. Let's strike now an' take their riches for ourselves!

Pah! Northmen! Those stinkin' Norscan raiders 'ave been spotted heading back north of Naggaroth frozen following a successful raid on the coasts of the Empire. This particular tribe are known always to take captives for ransom at a later date, so this is an ample opportunity to fill our ratings.

So it would appear that some enterprising fellows from the New World 'ave decided to risk it all against the elements an' of course ourselves, who surely 'ave nothin' left to lose anyway. It's looking pretty likely that Sartosa is their destination. Though they're well protected, taking their cargo as our prize presents an opportunity we daren't pass up.

A convoy of Dark Elf slave ships are heading back to Slaver's Bay, laden with captives raided from Ulthuan's coasts. We should free them... not for altruistic reasons, you understand, but because of their potential as fresh recruits to go on account with us an' join the crew - drowned, raised 'n' bound, they'll be worth more than a cutter full o'gold sovereigns!
We 'ave nothin' to lose in this situation, so should accept their offer an' take a cut of the plundered loot as payment.
The more pirates in one place, the more likely the authorities are to discover our presence. We can't take this risk, but can't rightly pass up the chance for plunder either. I say we attack - yarrr!
The time 'as come for us to assert our control over the seas. With this magical boon we'll be able to persevere through the greatest perils the Great Ocean can throw at us!
The time's come to make port an' build ourselves an empire, conquering new cities an' pillaging towns as we go. No hazards shall slow our advance!
Our fleet is already strong, so we must focus on buildin' up our settlements instead. We'll need to focus all resources an' labour on the towns to do this.
Our fleet is the backbone of our empire, so we must reinforce it if we're to, er, 'survive'. We'll need to divert all resources an' labour to our ships if this is to work!
We can't fight on without our weapons, so they must be protected from water damage where at all possible. Let's get 'em all up from the cargo hold at once, shall we?
We must protect ourselves first an' foremost, as a rusty sword will still end a man if wielded with purpose. I saw we move the armour to the upper deck before it's too late!
A large merchant vessel stocked with a variety of luxury goods 'as been spotted makin' for a juicy target. Let's head 'em off - after all, we can never 'ave too much treasure!
An unguarded civilian ship is transporting refugees nearby. This is excellent news - we always need fresh hands to join the crew!
We're eternal - time means little to an Undead crew. Therefore, let's wait until the winds blow favourably once more, shall we?

The dead lie in every corner of the world an' almost all of 'em would make acceptable crewmembers, with a little bit of bindin'. Should our current rabble crumble away we'll raise new forces in no time I'm sure. Let's march on!

The core of any army is its frontline troops, as any general worth their salt should surely know. If they break, everyone behind 'em becomes instantly vulnerable. These supplies will help our dead boys up the front, I reckon.

I've sailed many a year, and seen a lot of things go down, so I can say wiv confidence that the fastest way to kill your enemy is with a well-placed shot to their forehead! We should re-supply our gunners with haste - we don't wanna be caught out at sea!

Beware of strangers and their exotic gifts. Kill this imposter and have this box buried with them!

Let us spread the rumour that our foe has fallen under the sway of the Great Enemy. Incensed by this supreme act of blasphemy and corruption, our legions will fight more tirelessly than ever before.
Execute one fifth of the army. They are short-lived mortals, and some will be traitors. The rest will be afraid to act further.
Lace the bananas and melons with serpent venom, and this infestation shall soon run its course. Disposing of the endless simian corpses will be a fiendish task, however.

Pay the price and arrive faster maybe.

The aged seer should be obliterated for her preposterous demands. Yet a peculiar half-smile on her face seems to suggest she expects this fate...
The renegade deity can sabotage even hate itself, or so your frothing cultist claims. Zuvassin's intentions are frankly bewildering, but to dim an enemy's fury is surely to your benefit.
Zuvassin's mouthpiece claims that emptying a sack of gold into the nearest river will cause an equal number of eyeballs to rain from the sky  consuming them will grant your legion sight beyond sight.
Order the construction of a great war-pit, where you will challenge your doubters to face you in unarmed combat. Few will dare attempt this.
You could look the other way, but the obscene, carnal rituals intended to weaken your influence will continue unabated. Whether they succeed remains to be seen.
Order all involved in the libidinous rite flayed to death, and a vast and bleeding statue of your own form constructed from their remains.
Rather than end the carnal ceremony, you could take your measure of pleasure. The experience will be unforgettable, though your followers will regard you with disdain.
If the eight-pronged star of Chaos is burned into the screaming fiend's hide, they will know rage as never before.
The near-forgotten symbol of the first Everchosen is reputed to grant unnatural power to those whose flesh bears it.
There is no need to exert yourself more than is necessary by making a show of things  a river of Gnoblar blood will yield sufficient dividend.
The long and bloody hunt will be most invigorating, and the Ruinous Powers will surely provide appropriate reward for such entertainment.
To feast upon the betrayer's lifeblood will surely flood your immortal veins with Ruinous sorcery. Not to mention that your legion will revere you all the more for your brutality.
Crush the traitor's skull to pulp, then beckon your loyal champion to drink the grey-red gore from your great hand. They deserve ascension.
The colossal goblet, carved from a great skull of unknown origin, houses a gallon of boiling blood. Drinking deep of it will demonstrate your incomparable courage.
The yellow growth palpitates horribly. The thought of forcing the pulsing, reeking malignancy down your throat is nauseating, but it would earn the Fly Lord's love.
The crystal vial houses a lilac fluid, its scent intoxicating. You sense that dousing yourself with it will cause indescribable agony  but render you irresistible.
The nine-eyed, twisted face upon the hovering book's leathery cover tries to tear itself free at your approach. It seeks to bond itself to your flesh.
Order the immediate execution of every mortal kept in your dungeons and torture chambers, then burn the bodies in a vast pyre. The touch of Chaos shall grow yet stronger.
With their inhabitants in hiding or oblivious in their madness, there would be little resistance as your cackling Daemons scour nearby mortal homesteads for wealth.
An Exalted Bloodthirster shall replace the Herald of Khorne to lead this Daemonic army to even greater massacres. Skulls for the Skull Throne!
The Herald demands more time with this army to collect more skulls for Khorne. The Exalted one will return to claim the mantle of command in time.
To disobey Khorne's will is to invite His scrutiny; ensure the blood flows and the skulls are collected, or face His wrath.
An Exalted Great Unclean One shall replace the Herald of Nurgle to lead this Daemonic host to even greater contagions. Spread Grandfather's blessings!
The Herald has yet to unleash a tide of virulence. The Exalted One will return to claim the mantle of command in time.
Nurgle will let this act of defiance stand if the Herald successfully increases the Plague God's tally. To fail would not be wise.
An Exalted Keeper of Secrets shall replace the Herald of Slaanesh to lead this Daemonic host to even greater depravities. Hail the Dark Prince!
The Herald demurs for a truly violent release has yet to occur. The Exalted One will return to claim the mantle of command in time.
A selfish Herald, declining to be subsumed, wanting to experience the climax of depravity herself. Slaanesh is intrigued, but must not to be disappointed, or else
An Exalted Lord of Change shall replace the Herald of Tzeentch to lead this Daemonic host to even greater feats of destruction. Change is inevitable.
The Herald has plots in place that have yet to come to fruition. The Exalted One will return to claim the mantle of command in time.
Rebuffing Tzeentch's demand, the Herald puts his own schemes in play. Only fate will judge if this was a wise move.
We must make haste, or the campaign lost!
A cautious approach can be made.
Khorne prizes honour as much as He does wanton savagery. A contest of brutal champions would please the Blood God greatly.
These witless Bullgors regard Kharneth's Daemons as mere entertainment. They should be butchered for this affront.
At significant cost and effort, capture a pack of starving Yhetees from the mountains, and allow your followers to slake their battle-thirst upon the raging ice-beasts.
Surely the troublemakers will grow tired of their deafening protest eventually? There is always the risk that others may join them, however.
Desperate measures are called for. Only by tearing the ears from the skulls of every single fiend in your populace may they become immune to Slaanesh's hypnotic beat.
There is nothing for it but to join the dread drumming yourself. Perhaps it will inspire you to greater feats of slaughter? Or perhaps it will enable Slaanesh to seduce more to his cause?
Summon an ambassador from every empire  an unprecedented conclave of all this world's powers. Then disembowel them where they stand, and claim their high-ranking skulls for Kharneth.
Raze everything in your kingdom that is not brass, bone or steel. Leave nothing living, save for the mightiest of your Daemons.
If your blood legion is rendered irreversibly immune to Slaaneshi charms, they will surely prevail in battle against the Perfect Prince's perfumed fiends.
Storm every home, and behead any being caught in an act of congress. To be on the safe side, the same applies to all those guilty of reading poetry, playing games of chance, or drinking fine wines.
A simple proclamation of approval from the Skull Throne would be sufficient to send countless Daemons flocking to your cause.
None may leave Kharneth's service without His express decree. Should you desire it, the fulminated Bloodthirster will be reborn as a new and fiercely loyal servant of blood.
The container is emblazoned with  Khornate iconography. Though the enfeebled fiends will escape, to refuse this relic of the Skull Throne would be blasphemy.
No trinket can make an act of mercy forgivable. Ignore the relic, and grant a brutal second death to each and every one of these Unliving wretches.
The ruined flesh atop their fiendish heart will grow nigh-unbreakable as it knits.
Have your follower render themselves so horrific to gaze upon that their every enemy will loose their bowels in terror.
Show your respect to a worthy foe, and teach your complacent allies that Khornate tolerance of others only lasts until the next great battle.
Deposit a slaughtered Stonehorn before an erstwhile rival's gates  a vast and bloody tribute to prove that you consider them worthy.
Select the strongest Bloodletter from every regiment, harvest their skulls, fill them to the brim with blood and then send this great tribute to your foe.
Arrange for the capture of one of their weaker underlings. They will yield soon their secrets if they value their skull.

Instil new fervour within the populace. Make every child understand exactly what happens when Ruin visits Kislev. As the nightmares grip them, they will beg their parents to protect them, no matter the cost.
The other kingdoms do not realise how close doom is to their doors. We must send our most gifted orators to make these pampered fools understand. Once they do, they will surely aid our cause.
Warm her frozen blood with our finest Kvas. And once her palate has known the incomparable taste of Jewel of Kislev, she will pay a king's ransom for more.
They will want to know that she is alive, and she will want them to know that she is so much stronger than they realise.
Have the farmer ask this crack of his to grant Kislev's armies the strength of the soil.
Have the farmer request that the Motherland bless us with the power of the elements.
Let us bury this magnificent beast on the Hill of Heroes, for it deserves respect and peace, not a gaudy show. Honour the bears, and they will honour us.
Bid a public farewell with flame and fervour, in the heart of Geroyev Square. Doubtless, this show of pomp and ceremony will inspire others to pledge themselves to Ursun.
Years of flash-flooding and countless thousands of footsteps have taken a heavy toll on the ancient market. Restore its former glory, and goods will flow like never before.
We have long consigned Bretonnian artisans to one of the most forlorn areas of the city, but they do know a thing or two about steel. Let us gain their favour, and in turn their wisdom.
Food is too precious in Praag to waste even this monstrously spoiled harvest. Perhaps it may even be a boon to sorcery, though who knows what horror will we invite across our threshold?
Though our populace will go hungry, we cannot permit this foul affliction to pass into proud Kislevite blood. Once the fasting is done, purity shall reign.
Search the fields and barns, scour the grain silos and troughs, comb the wells and riverbeds. If a sorcerous artifact is responsible for this corruption, it must be ours.
The Akshina can resolve this discreetly. While he espouses mayhem and heresy, perhaps a chimney could topple from a nearby rooftop. We will then buy  the silence of all who ask questions.
If our response is too brazen, there will be those who feel we only prove his point. It would be better to quietly inform him that his current course of action is unwise.

If trust is so hard won, then, alas, fear it must be. Have our most devout Patriarchs flay his traitorous flesh, remove his fingers then, finally, burn him alive. There will doubtless be turmoil, but we can control that.

So the Motherland's errant children dare to doubt us. They will soon discover what happens when they no longer have faith to armour them. Chaos will stalk their land, and they will only have themselves to blame.
Smear the buboe with carrion, mulch and excrement in the hope it will grow yet more fecund, and thus feed the land with Nurgle's putrescent power.
Whatever pestilent horrors swim within this vast and necrotic edifice shall be loosed upon the land, spreading the Urfather's foul touch wherever they go.
If buried within the soil and carefully tended to, the putrescent sac  no doubt sent from the Fly Lord's decomposing Garden  shall surely bear uncommonly rancid seed.
There is no better breeding ground for Nurgle's putrid spawn than dung-caked waste-tunnels. In those filthy depths, the egg-fruit will birth something marvellously mephitic.
Imagine the glorious putrescence that will result from carrion on this scale! Should its rot be expedited, Grandfather will doubtless shower you with rancid gifts.
The vast cadaver will make a fine breeding ground for pox-spreading insects. The foul grubs will grow fat upon its mouldering flesh, and upon reaching adulthood they will blight the land.
Your champion can rake away the pollution, but doing so will scrub off vast strips of their own mouldering meat. Such a beauteous emissary of Nurgle they shall be.
The foul gut-fluids will bubble and burn indefinitely, and your faithful follower shall leave a glistening trail of infection wheresoever they tread.
If your rotted legion barely have minds left to twist, they will become inherently resistant to madness. Tzeentch's changelings will thus be powerless against them.
All corvids must be slain on sight. In fact, anything with feathers is fair game, lest it be a sorcerous emissary of the Raven God.
The filthy flood-waters contain generations of waste, and thus will be a breeding ground for manifold new and wondrous diseases. Truly, this is a miracle of science!
Order your Tallybands to bathe in the disease-strewn brown waters. The countless bacteria within shall work wonders upon their festering flesh.
Miracles should not be expected, for Plaguebearers' vocal cords have nigh-on rotted away. Guiding them into a simple three-note refrain will yield potent results, however.
So slow-witted are Plaguebearers that the process will be torturous, but you believe you can teach them a basic summoning chant.
Sneaking the brain-grub past all those bodyguards and henchmen will be a breathtakingly expensive business, but infecting the ruler of an empire will have truly transformative results
It will be easy enough to have the grub feast upon a low-ranking brain, and once done they will quietly sow warm sentiment about us throughout their lands.
Once your enemy's rank-and-file have imbibed parasite-polluted waters, they will be too besotted to do battle with your rancid legions.
While this has perhaps unwelcome overtones of Slaaneshi sorcery, causing a high-ranking foe to become captivated by your singularly horrendous form would yield invaluable insights.
Maybe they're bored of eatin' the same ol' raw flesh for sixteen meals a day. Tell the Butchers to make somethin' fancier, like stuffin' one kind of meat with another kind of meat. Delicious, yeah?
An Ogre who don't wanna eat ain't no Ogre at all. Shrug it off an' the skinny ones'll just get eaten by the fatter ones. Survival of the fittest, innit?

Get raidin' like never before, and round up the finest meats, cheeses, cakes and boozes in the 'old world. We're gonna have ourselves the buffet to end all buffets. If this don't fatten 'em up, nothin' will.
This ain't natural. Probably them Chaos lads are muckin' about again. Whatever it is, we ain't got no use for skinny Bulls. Might as well feed 'em to somethin' wot will eat, yeah?
Feed 'em them lava-chillies the Butchers have been too scared to touch. Once they've finished thrashing in agony they'll soon be belchin' fire. Maw only knows what they'll break first, mind.
All that grease on their flesh will make our boys burn a treat. They won't thank us for the pain and the flames'll probably spread, but the scars'll make 'em tough as old boots.
No point in muckin' about. The tribe's 'ungry, so let's chop this sucker down and work out who gets to eat what.
Tasty as this magic meat tree looks, if we gnosh the whole thing now it ain't never gonna grow more chops. Just pick the ripe ones, yeah?
It'll fill up the loot-pile alright, but the tribe ain't gonna be 'appy that you ain't sharin' it around. They'll probably 'ave a massive sulk.
A few shiny things for every Bull sounds a like a plan. They'll surely blow it all on meat 'n' booze, and maybe stop botherin' you for it for a while.
Look, this duel ain't gonna pretty to watch, so might as well set 'im against someone who'll get it over with as soon as possible, yeah?
This old Bull couldn't beat a Gnoblar in a stand-up fight, so no point in makin' a show of things. Just let whoever's gut is rumblin' loudest 'ave themselves an easy meal.
It don't matter 'ow that beast ended up so weird, we can't let good meat go to waste. Get those 'earts cooked sharpish, then get 'em in the tribe's guts.
The Butcher's itchin' to get slicin' and dicin' all those 'earts. Reckons 'e can perfect 'is art or something. Don't see the 'arm in it.
Gnoblars don't taste great  far too stringy, innit? Maybe these little-nosed types will 'ave a bit more fat on 'em, mind.
We can thump some sense into 'em. Or out of 'em, as the case may be. The other Gnoblars'll look at 'em funny, but that don't matter.
Toss a few prime cuts the Maw's way and the ol' god-mouth's bound to settle down. Might even belch us up a nice reward.
Fair's fair, the tribe's only had eight breakfastses today. Stuff a bit more fat 'n' grease down 'em and they'll be right as rain. Better, even.
Have our boy put the 'ole lot of 'em down.  It'll be a nasty old fight, but we don't want anyone else thinkin' they can come an' give us gyp whenever they feel like it.
One-to-one our boy'll win, though them hooks'll tear chunks outta the poor bastard's gut. A smaller belly's nothin' to be proud of, but a win's a win, and at least he'll eat less after.
There's a fence on the Ivory Road who'll buy anything. Maw only knows it's the last deal the mad bastard will ever do, but it ain't like we care.
We'll lose a few boys in the process, but we can make these pups do what we says. Once they're all grown up, we got ourselves a weapon, yeah?
There'll be Bulls queuing up to fight for ya if it means they get to splatter some of this red stuff on their lunch. 'Course, they'll probably eat us outta house and home.
No self-respectin' Ogre stuffs anything that ain't meat down their maw. Get the tribes back on a pure-flesh diet, and their guts'll soon be bigger than ever.
The first taste is free. All others come at a heart-stopping cost. But rest assured, all who sample this incomparable wine will gladly, desperately pay any price for more of it.
Your pleasure-toys will rhapsodise about the drink's wondrous qualities to their countless other partners. Soon enough, all will beg to join your cause, hoping for a taste of their own.
Absence makes the heart grow fonder  and no doubt the loins too. If the people are forcibly denied that which they have grown bored of, they will soon desperately desire its return.
While it seems unthinkable that your people are bored of transgression, perhaps they simply need encouragement. With a little more imagination, could this torpor resolve itself?
Somehow, lust has been swapped for rage. To undo this will require a great harvest of souls, which will then be imbibed by your populace. Their loins shall soon be aflame once more.
There is Khornate blood in the water supply: so that is how this pleasure-slaying sabotage was wrought. There is nothing for it but wait for the boiling ichor to drain away.
Carve the mark of Slaanesh into their hide, six hundred times over. Let suffering be their mantra, let pain be their guiding light, and let torment drive them forth.
Hang their flesh with glittering piercings, infuse their blood with intoxicating spices and rub aromatic lotions into their supple skin. They will be made irresistible.
So nightmarish and so endless is the composition that eardrums will burst, eyeballs will melt and brains will bleed. This mass sacrifice will be delicious indeed, and the dark rewards immeasurable.

Their suffering will be exquisite to behold. They will beg you to stop before their senses are forever ruined and their very souls forfeit, and thus will gladly pay any price to end this free-verse torture.
No-one, not even the Dark Prince himself, may rob you of your legendary allure. Demolish the portrait to restore your perfect form, and you shall bathe in pleasure-slaves like never before.

Beauty is not binary. Convention is stagnation. Embrace your changed image. Own your changed form, and wield it like the flawless weapon it is. This is perhaps the greatest lesson of the Perfect Prince  a reward may follow in time.

In truth, the doubters would do anything, anything to know your embrace. Afterwards, they will tell of the unforgettable sensations they experienced, and countless more will beg to do the same. Glory be to Slaanesh!

This, too, is a test from Slaanesh. Resist despair and silence the scurrilous voices, together with all those who have heard them. As they die in torment, the Dark Prince will thank you for this banquet of souls.
Send the Druchii to your decadent brothers and sisters in sin. They will be so very easily made willing, and your freshly-satiated kin will owe you a debt of gratitude.

If it is cruelty they desire, then cruelty they shall receive. Release the Druchii, naked and unarmed, into battle, and no servant of Kharneth will be able to resist this invitation to slaughter. The distraction will serve us well.

Meaty walls clamp tight to you as you climb through the oozing fissure. They hold you there for six days and six nights, flexing and moaning all the while. When you are finally released, delirious from near-asphyxiation, something gleams in your exhausted hand.
Slaanesh desires an offering. Promise a captivated mortal the pleasures of your flesh if only they will venture inside the trembling aperture. There, they will know His touch and be forever changed.

It is outrageous that there exists anyone who does not dream of you night and day, let alone an entire empire. A spell of temptation on this scale will be draining indeed, but a great wrong must be righted.
Once we know what forbidden sins their leaders secretly crave, we may tease them with the forever-unfulfilled promise of indulging these deviant desires. In this way, they shall become ours.

There is more to Slaanesh than simple sin and suffering. Perform a great opera for our enemies, a flawless artistic accomplishment to melt even the coldest of souls. As they fall to their knees in desperate gratitude, the Dark Prince shall applaud.

One unforgettable night of fine wine, heavenly music and extreme debauchery will be all it takes to coax secrets and strategies from their hungry lips. How Slaanesh will revel in our foe's subsequent suffering.
This gift from Tzeentch will undoubtedly grant dark knowledge, though the struggle to adapt to their newly-divided mind will cause grievous harm to your follower.
Excise the uninvited presence, lest it seize control of your follower's body. The experience will be horrific, but your champion will only grow stronger for it.
The sacred number heralds sublime transmutation. Offer up an icon of Tzeentch and it shall be transformed!
Abduct a condemned man, chain him to a dead tree, and leave him to hear the constant dirge for nine days and nine nights. Then, he will be ours.
Have your Sorcerers invoke a great ward of stabilisation. Though draining, it should lock your followers' fluctuating forms to this plane of existence.
Such is the nature of Change. If this is the Great Schemer's will, any consequences are inevitable, no matter which course of action you might take.
Scour the libraries for spells of voiding. If one does not work, move on to the next. Do whatever it takes to find a magical vaccine for Nurgle's latest pox.

When sufficient numbers of the Changer's Followers have dissolved into horrific goo, those not yet infected will most probably be immune to the plague's deliquescent touch. The casualties shall be many, however.
Grant unto your champion an aura of whispering tendrils around their head, which as they writhe and twitch shall siphon magic away from your foes.
Grant unto your champion a cloud of phantom hands around their feet, forever clawing at the air and drumming their hideous fingers upon the earth.
Chant the scar-drawn runes aloud, and your changelings' limbs will catch alight with blue-gold fire  all the better to burn away diseased flesh.
The inscription will grant voice to your army's every missile, magical or otherwise  an ethereal shriek capable of reversing decay.
Your marionette believes she can steal a treasured relic from the Grand Observatory of Xing Po. No doubt it will prove useful, once the gore is scrubbed from it.
Instruct your puppet to adorn herself with whatever precious trinkets she can grab, before she embarks upon her final voyage.
Their flesh shall erupt in squirming tendrils and shapeless new limbs, chattering mouths will sprout upon their hides, and indescribable new creatures shall be birthed from their spines.
All reason shall leave them, and they shall forever speak in half-truths, impossible prophecies and unknown tongues. All who hear them will suffer the same fate.
Tzeentch will shower your ally's foe with gifts, each emblazoned with His writhing rune. This open declaration of forbidden admiration shall birth purest disorder.
Subtlety yields the greatest rewards. Tzeentch will whisper your sometime rival's darkest truths to you, in order that they will become beholden to us.
Have the fingers discreetly seek out your enemy's lords and generals, tunnel through their ears and into their minds, and there rewrite their very thoughts.
Once the disembodied digits dig painlessly into the eyeballs of your foe's soldiers, their sight shall become yours. The cost of concealing this grand act of sorcery will, however, be high.
You decide to focus on getting rid of any and all Orcs around you!
You will maintain control and balance!
Ah, the scent of past glories. Relive them again and Slaanesh will reward you now.
There is little time to bask in your own arrogance. Descend to the next circle.
Listen to the voices, let them remind you of your many victories. Well done.
Never mind this self-congratulatory preening. Descend to the next circle.
Your army will be ejected from the Chaos Realms.
A race does not have to be won in a sprint. Let fools go on while you marvel as your treasury grows fat.
The gems are eggs for Daemon birthlings, the statues are hollow and the gold is worthless to all but Dwarfs. Pass through the gate and descend to the next circle.
Gold builds empires and a small delay is a minor cost for such a generous gift.
To stay and revel in the baubles is to forget why we come here. Descend to the next circle.
All you need do is sit but for a moment upon this throne and great power shall be yours.
Power for the sake of power is no power at all. Descend to the next circle.
Such power is yours to command, Slaanesh shall gift you armies if you but agree.
True power lies at the heart of the Dark Prince's realm  descend to the next circle.
Food, sustenance, even Daemons eat (be it souls). The Dark Prince offers a large satisfying feast.
There is no time to sample this fare. Pass through the gate and descend to the next circle.
Delicious morsels that shall banish famine, there is more than enough for all.
The hungry starve, as it has always been. Descend to the next circle.
Lie here. Close your eyes. Rest.
Let us rest, you'll not regret it.
A tryst with the Dark Prince's lovers will bring great pleasure and ensure your armies are fully stocked  for the paramours are always fertile.
Let them frolic with each other, for the palace is closer. Descend to the next circle.
Cavort while you can. Slaanesh will bless us for bringing such pleasure into existence.
Ignore the fools that pander to such base urges  descend to the next circle.
Tzeentch will allow fresh warriors to be transported here.

Bring spells and magic weapons to the fore.
Conventional tactics and stout hearts will see us victorious.
Cast out the traitors who stand against you!
Gerik persuades me to show mercy.
This book is for your eyes only.
I am Prince of the Ungols and the Chaos Wastes!
Everything I have done is to find Ursun, nothing more.
Reward their continued loyalty with extra rations.
I suffered in the maze, not them.
Take it. The sword will defend Kislev.
Take it. The sword will slay our enemies.
Treat their bodies with respect and their Gods may not perceive us as enemies.
Curse our enemies and ransack what is left of the ruins.
Take on the trial to defeat two armies of Tzeentch.
Take on the trial to capture a Tzeentch stronghold.
Take the offerings of those who fear you.
A trade will not leave you as obligated.
Go to the Beacon to save Kislevite lives above all else.
Hurry to punish the tribal chief that threatens the Beacon.
Harnessing the Gorebulls destructive nature is the obvious choice. The great, weird moon - Morrslieb - hangs low; we are incensed!
What do the Chaos Gods whisper? What dark machinations do they plot? The Bray-Shaman will surely reveal these secrets to us...
Take what you can from them to sustain us and let us be gone!
Their temples and pitiful gods lay before us, ripe for desecration. Let us leave our mark and be on our way.
The proud and ignorant Empire are a bigger prize. Their flesh will taste all the better for the challenge!
Bretonnians are arrogant and foolish people, haughty and easily exploited. Let us take them apart.
The whelp has learned his place. Removing his horns ensures he can never again challenge you. A good decision, and punishment enough - he can re-join the herd.
Insubordination is unacceptable. The entire herd must know of your unswerving will - that you and you alone are Lord of them all! Put him to death!
What is madness but a gift from the Gods? Some will fall to the creature's maddening influence, but the rest of the herd will be greatly improved by the abomination's presence.
We do not need this bizarre curio to win the day. Our enemies are Uncloven fools and will be rended by our power alone!
What dark favour is brought forth by our dedication to destruction and ruin? We will receive it in payment!
Your refusal of our master's Ruinous generosity has signalled your strength to others, who now flock to your warherd, desperate to fight under such a powerful Beastlord.
They could not be stopped now even if you wanted it. Revelry is in their blood - let them feast! Let them be raucous! They will be grateful for it.
No matter what their blood calls for, the herdstone must be worshipped! The Ruinous rites must be obeyed!
The great herdstone at the Heart of the Dark calls out. Who are we to stop the pull of that foul and powerful monolith?
Although denied his opportunity, the Shaman resolves to remain and draw the Greater Winds of Magic across the blood-ground!
The Gods must be appeased and their Ruinous gifts bestowed upon us once more. Kill the warriors! Accept the price! Blood for the Blood God!
The herd is yours and nobody - not even the Gods - can wrest it from your control.
The call cannot be ignored! Though answering it may thin our numbers, those that survive will fight stronger for it. There only the roar of battle - the call of blood!
We need no brayherd to make our way in the world, we can create destruction and discord very well on our own!
They can worship the Chaos Gods if they like, but there is only ruin to be found in such a foolish course of action!
They are not the children of Chaos. The Uncloven Ones must pay the price for their ignorance! Human blood must ALWAYS be spilled.
The herd can replace their fallen with ferocious alacrity, yet the latecomers are more reluctant to fight.

Vampires respond best to a show of brutal force. Vlad's rage was legendary back in the day, remind these fools why - let the bloodletting begin!
Vlad is a charismatic creature of low cunning when he can best his temper. This was how he first seduced the nobility of Sylvania. A promise to share wealth and power should lure them to his side.
Our kin have travelled far with gladness in their heart, a gladness we share fully - grant them their audience, let them treat with us as family.
The arrogance! After so long, and so much silence, they deem us worthy to talk with them? No! Send them back across the waves; we care not!
Cast them out. These Dryads have done us a great wrong but to destroy them would be to anger the forest. Send them away; far away!
This slight against the Asrai cannot go unpunished. Introduce them to their mortal foe; turn them into kindling for the great pyre!
There is no hope that this impetuous knave can hope to best a Wardancer, but it would be an amusement to see him try. Take the wager!
This insolence adds another heinous crime to the list. You will suffer it no more. Kill him immediately!
In these troubled times, the wisdom of Asuryan flies as true as any Elven arrow.
We are in a dark and bitter age; the battle-hardened fury of Khaine would surely be a boon to our efforts.
This scheme, although shameless, can only help to undermine the haughty Bretonnians who encroach on the forest. Aid them we shall!
Such underhanded plans are not fit for the nobility of the Elven High Houses. Tell Cavaroc they must do this without our blessing!
Though the Dreaming Wood is steeped in treachery, this Glade Lord's intentions are noble. Who are we to stop them?
No. The Dreaming Wood is forbidden for a reason. Slaanesh cannot claim another Asrai soul. Not this day!
This was a warrior, who deserves a warrior's send-off. Light the pyres, prepare the bier, and let us do this one justice!
As we are all born from the forest, so we return to the forest. Dig the hole deep; let the forest reclaim its child
The Hunt makes fair targets of us all; the Great Stag will make a dazzling addition to any hunter's trophy collection.
The soul of the forest is sacred; the beast should not be harmed, representing as it does the spirit of Athel Loren.
What dark and twisted deeds they may be weaving throughout the Night Glens is their business, and the repercussions theirs to deal with. You will have no part of it
Though these spells are not strictly permitted, what may be advantage to the Asrai should surely be harnessed?
The fatter they become, the greater the eventual sacrifice. Have patience and it shall be rewarded in the end.
The guests have enjoyed our hospitality for long enough. It is time they repaid our kindness with the ultimate generosity. Prepare them!
The merchants and craftsmen of the city are hard workers and deserve this small token of gratitude!
Will they stop their ceaseless complaining if we feed them this once? I suppose we can find out.

Gold should help smooth their Lords transition to serving under our banner.

The wealth of our blacksmiths and armourers is theirs - let them be the most resplendent in all the world!
Let us feast to give thanks! Increase the levy on the peasants; we shall have what we need!
The time has come to wipe these demons and blighted scourges from our lands. To the wastes  bring war to Chaos!
These filthy, loathsome masses have endured too long. Now we shall end them forever  March on the Badlands with haste!
Treason is treason - have him hanged like a common criminal. His entire family can die with him too.
There is no need to be savage - simply cripple the man, and take the grain back.
The Fay Enchantress and her Damsels will be able to offer the best advice to the children; request their aid.
There are means at our immediate disposal to aid their training - let us help these children.
Placing this idol at the centre of our city would inspire great faith in the people!
The statue is important to the locals. Who are we to interfere with the realm's stability?
The nobles can hunt wherever they wish; it is, after all, their land
There are much better areas to hunt than this squalid furrow.
The Lady will forever have a friend in us; make the donation.
Get the peasants to donate to their cause.
No. These words may inspire others to worse disrespect - fashion a strongly-worded reply!
Idle banter is none of our concern - let these chickens cluck!
Close the Gates! Quarantine the infected! We need to keep this out!
There is no pox; our apothecaries saw to that. Do not panic.
Danger comes at all times; the future is now, let us grow strong from our achievements.
The future is unforeseeable; let us store this surplus, for one day we may need it more.
Alberic has no time to waste. If the man's information holds true, then seeing honour and justice restored to the realm will be more than worth the price. Pay him.
Extortion! He may be desperate, but Alberic is no shill and will not be humiliated by this lowlife. Have the information drawn from him, by force!
Let the Lady see that we are nurturing her land.
The blessing was first received by the destruction of our enemies - let us prove ourselves in battle again!
Magic cannot be left unchecked. Burn the entire village if you must; stop this aberration.
Very superstitious! When you believe in things you don't understand, then you suffer!
A wise choice. Better to be part of the great invasion - to fight at the side of the Everchosen - than be wiped out before it even begins.
If the End Times come, it should be you that brings them about! Why be subservient to this self-entitled fool? Reject his offer and care not for his ire.
Armour is not essential when it comes to slaughtering enemies!
Your warriors need only the strength of their hands to tear the foe limb to limb!
These ferocious beasts have the power to tear apart your enemies.
Armed men on horseback will trample and run down their enemies!
Your warriors' blades will be stronger with blood on the inside - and soon on the outside.
The blood fortifies your men's armour, and the sight of it instills fear in the enemy.
Raid the southerners' farms and ravage their lands, take their food and let your warriors revel in their blood.
Strike at the southerners where they feel safest, and show them that neither walls nor castles will keep them safe.
The Seers speak the words of the Gods! Even you must heed them sometimes, although it may slow your advance.
If the path ahead is filled with the blood of your warriors then they are too weak and deserve to fall.
This will be no challenge for your Trolls, who were raised in such brutal places.
Your warriors will welcome the chance to face such harshness. They are up to the task.

They are skilled warriors and fighters who are willing to sacrifice themselves to the Gods!
They reinforce our buildings, ensuring our people remain strong against the might of the north!
Your warriors will have to endure the cold on their feet. It will remind them of where they come from!
The men's arms should be constantly swinging their blades and never stay still long enough to be hit.
Sacrifice slaves to the ravenous beast, and the gods will favour you with its savagery and might.
Sacrifice slaves to the Reptilian creature, and the gods will favour you with its fearsome and vicious nature.
You cannot risk angering the Gods! Order the men to look to the shrines!
You hold the fruits of many raids and cannot bear to lose such hard-won rewards. Reinforce the loot piles!
Take all their iron, metal and pots - anything that can be melted down to become weapons ready to be bloodied.
Take their meat and their mead; these weak fools do not need victuals now they are all dead!
Discover where he is from and you can find his village, and learn how it endured for so long.
Find the secrets of the ancient weapons and combat techniques and you may discover new ways to slaughter more enemies.
The Ice Trolls come from this land. The cold is nothing for them.
Marauder Hunters are used to this type of terrain, they will traverse it swiftly and easily.
No more delays! Pay the greedy slaver and be done with it.
By pillaging these lands, the slave can be taken by force!
We need the information, pay the filthy Goblins.
It could be risky, but stealing the Bretonnian from right under their noses would be much cheaper.
The promises of riches and power are beguiling and the cost is so little. This may well be a worthy investment and a chance to scry the hidden land of Albion.
Send this dark emissary on his way! There is nothing in Albion for us, let some other fool pay for this creature's shadow war.
The promises of riches and power are beguiling and the cost is so little. This may well be a worthy investment and a chance to scry the hidden land of Albion.
Send this dark emissary on his way! There is nothing in Albion for us, let some other fool pay for this creature's shadow war.
Let us make an example of these rumour-mongers and malicious gossips. A punishment is called for.
While you cannot be dictated to by rumours and whispers, less time boasting and more spent planning future victories might be wiser.
There will be a large tribute, the day marked with a great feast or sacrifice.
Let them stew! They should be patient, for your realm will endure and grow and they will reap the benefit.
There is no room for refugees here. Turn them back and let the gods decide their fate.
There are always wars to fight, so more bodies could be useful. Welcome them with a smile, they will pay for this hospitality at a later time.
An offering to our gods and to the warriors' own purses should improve matters and help them find their boldness.
The dark moon can be seen by anybody looking to the night sky. Who says it is an omen aimed solely at them?
Summon an Orc Shaman for questioning...
Summon a Night Goblin Shaman for questioning...
Let the Gods look elsewhere. Their gaze will return in time and then they will see all your good works.
A grand slaughter or some other vainglorious gesture is needed to get the Eye of the Gods to flicker open.
Let us relent on the fighting, and let the insurrection begin from within.
Let Nurgle come and visit his festerlings and buboes on those lucky folk in the south.
When men get cold - as they do in the north - they look for warmer pleasures, vices and carnal sport.
There is nothing more important than avenging every grudge. Are we not Dawi? The debt must be settled in blood and damn the cost!
Foolish Dwarf! Of course the grudge must be settled no matter the cost! Now, bring the foe to account and we'll have no more 'wobbles' from you!
We cannot overlook a loss of honour, as an ally it reflects on us too. He must take the oath and seek his doom. We will have to take the loss of influence.
We need his sway in the Guilds if the Karaz Ankor is to be resurgent. Matters of familial pride can wait for more peaceable times.
No Dwarf folk should be left in such peril. It may upset the balance of local politics to do this before the resident Lord calls the Clans, but the grobi must be broken.
Clan politics in the region are complicated. Interfering in this local issue could unbalance the situation. Let them sort it out themselves.
Umgi are not the real enemy. If we share our advances with allies then this will be for the benefit of all.
We have given the umgi enough! And are they ever grateful? They are as likely to use it against us as the true foe.
This Clan should be rewarded for its loyal service. Let them have the mine and we can expect a large tithe when the gold flows.
This act of generosity to your rivals shows that you are as wise as Grungni. The Clan will begrudge the gesture but will acknowledge its debt to you.
The Elector Counts and the lesser nobles have more than enough, a new reign calls for a new approach. Take it from them and distribute it among more deserving subjects.
The politics of the Altdorf court are deep and complex. You will need the favour of both Graf and noble in the campaign to come. Better to keep them onside
The army must behave and uphold the tenets of Sigmar or else we are no better than the Northmen. The soldiers will be punished!
This is an ugly part of war, but a reality nonetheless. Our many enemies do not treat the people any better.
Another feast day and an offering to Shallya and Taal should keep the smallfolk in this region content for now.
They must pay, as does every other man and woman in the Empire. In the meantime the Witch Hunters will seek out the rabble-rousers and silence them!
The Brass Sentinel sends warning of an impending enemy incursion, we should abide by the monitory and send a force to intercept!
The Brass Sentinel system is ancient and outdated. This will be another ghost message - if we send an army, we deprive more important areas of protection.
Agreed, the Elder of the Moot is an Elector and so has political clout, even if the Moot's protection is not our top priority.
There are many more important provinces requiring our soldiers' attention than the Moot, they should muster their own fighting cocks!
Give 'em a fair share of da loot and one or two bitz from da pile of shiny stuff, dat should keep 'em loyal.
You're da biggest and da baddest. Call 'em back 'ere and make 'em piss dere britches. Scare da crap out of 'em. Dat'll get rid of any rebellious thoughts!
Da boyz need a good slap and rip one of 'em apart for good measure. Then get the thievin' gits to take da loot back, so we can stay all friendly like.
Dat Boss Wossisname is a git anyway. And all dat loot is lovely an' makes the pile of shiny stuff even bigga!
Ain't no zoggin room for dese gits. Shove off!
More boyz da bigga da Waaagh! Dat's logic, don't matter if some of dem stink.
Yoo want yer teef, as iz yer right as da big Boss. If 'ee don't give yer some, den punch 'im in the mouth and take iz teef instead!
Well, ee's a good 'un. And if 'ee did nick some loot, den wots a few teef between mates? Now, if he does it again, den we'll 'ave to get mean
The carrot is favoured over the stick. A visit in the dead of night, under the guise of a bat swarm, and a drop of unholy blood should remind him of his agenda.
The stick instead of the carrot. Such insolence from a mortal servant cannot be tolerated. Visit him in his chambers and make his last moments agony.
She has proven an unworthy landlord. Take her lands and give them to another sire.
The smallfolk are there to be culled and snacked upon. It is our right! If the mortals dare to rebel then let us deal with it then.
Slay this fool where he stands and take these so-called "artefacts". No Mortarchs will be created this day.
It bodes well to have these thralls out there in the world hunting such miscellany down. Most will be fake but Nagash is out there somewhere
So they stamp and scream like little children? Then they must live with the consequences of demanding a Vampire Count's attention
Their time will come, but for now the prize lies at the heart of the Old World, not on its periphery.
There is great power in this nameless creature, we will not confront it yet.
No thing, living or dead, should dare challenge us!

Grombrindal thinks the wait worth it to taste one of Bugman's legendary brews. Its fortifying effects will boost the White Dwarf's already considerable might. So what if there are more enemies to fight? They will all die with ease.
As tempting as one of Bugman's concoctions is, Grombrindal wishes to be away, for there are scores to settle and Beastmen to kill!

One legend speaks of a drinking match between Grimnir and Grombrindal. If one drunk the other under the table it was never disclosed, although all variations of the story agree that the beer stores from miles around ran dry and a strong warrior bond was formed between the two.

Who is the White Dwarf? A king called Snorri? A lost god? A wanderer? All of this and more? One thing is certain, when he puts his mind to something - when he deems a grudge worthy of striking from his pages - then no hell hath the fury to match the White Dwarf!

There are songs sung of the love between Grombrindal and Valaya. Such chorales are not performed within presence of the White Dwarf, for that would be unseemly. After all, Valaya was the wife of Grungni... Whatever the truth, the sagas do not doubt that the White Dwarf held a special place in her heart, so her protection, when called upon, is assured.

Grungni was the first Dwarf to delve into rock, and so his wisdom is vast, his eye for gold and minerals unrivalled. The White Dwarf can call upon his judgement and - should Grungni be in a generous mood - receive the teachings of a god.
